definition: colt/pony
small/tiny/few/young
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
Equuleus (constellation)

sentences.english: Scott led by people with a pony and Amundsen led equipped with the dogs and ski.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特率領的人與小馬和亞孟森領導配備警犬和滑雪。

sentences.english: I combed my hair with my hair brush and made it into a pony.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的梳子梳頭並把頭髮弄成小馬辮。

sentences.english: The ponys coat looked orangish yellow, and the ponys tail had no hair.
sentences.chinese: 小馬身上的毛泛着橘黃色，尾巴上一根毛都沒有。

sentences.english: But the pony simply has very short legs.
sentences.chinese: 結果卻是小馬只是腿短而已。

sentences.english: Also, who is smart like seismograph, omnipotent spy Xiao Ma.
sentences.chinese: 還有，一個如地震儀般機靈，又無所不能的特務小馬。

sentences.english: Traveling in China is chiefly done by sedan chair, sometimes by donkey or pony.
sentences.chinese: 在中國旅行主要是坐轎子，有時候騎驢或小馬。

sentences.english: Reds boss Roy Hodgson is considering Melo as a direct replacement for want-away defensive midfielder Javier Mascherano.
sentences.chinese: 老霍考慮把梅洛作爲想走的後腰小馬的直接替代者。

sentences.english: One day, a colt took a bag of wheat to the mill.
sentences.chinese: 一天，小馬馱着麥子去磨坊。

sentences.english: And she followed him into the kitchen like a pony on high heels.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他來到廚房，像匹踩着高蹺的小馬。

sentences.english: Min Min had done her best but the green pony was just ahead of her.
sentences.chinese: 敏敏已經盡力了，綠衣小馬還是在它的前面。

sentences.english: The mare gave birth to a colt.
The thief slipped away down a side street.
sentences.chinese: 小偷闃然從一條小馬路溜走了。

sentences.english: Tell him to catch the ponies and saddle up.
sentences.chinese: 叫他牽住小馬並套上馬鞍。

sentences.english: One of the farmers owned a mare that had foaled in the marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個農夫擁有的一匹母馬，在市場誕下了小馬。

sentences.english: She felt as much out of place as a colt in a flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 她覺得好似一匹小馬掉進了花園裏一樣彆彆扭扭。

definition: just now/a moment ago
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
arrogant idler/self-centered show-off
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
old fellow/old man/father/husband
(coll.) father's father/paternal grandfather/CL:個|个[ge4]
girl/servant girl/(used deprecatingly, but sometimes also as a term of endearment)
son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
not bad/tolerable/fortunately
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
promptly/at once
nickname
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
hurriedly/without delay
